talk15:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>The Gibdos may be preparing to attack as
we speak.

The <clr:0000>new unit<clr:ffff> needs to be ready to meet
them in battle. Otherwise, it'll be like the
<clr:0000>first encounter<clr:ffff> all over again...
talk28:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>Hey! Voe!


If you need something, talk to me!


I don't want you getting in the way of the
sword-and-shield unit, OK?
talk16:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>I hear there's some kind of strange event
going on around <clr:0000>Kara Kara Bazaar<clr:ffff>.

Tch... We need to get the new sword-and-
shield unit trained ready for action.
talk17:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>I'll have to treat everyone in the new unit
to a drink at the canteen. They've earned
it, that's for sure.
<sp:3:0:2:0c01>Wait... <sp:5:1:0>What am I saying? We're not done.


<sp:3:0:2:0701>While we've successfully defended the
town, we aren't out of danger yet.

Make sure you don't lose focus either!
talk18:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>But after learning an entirely new way to
fight, all the members of our new sword-
and-shield unit deserve a little break.
I'll invite them all to meet at the canteen
soon! It'll be my treat!
talk20:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Yeah. The first time we fought the
Gibdos, they had us on our heels the
whole time...
Numbers and strength were on their side.
The best we could do was an organized
retreat to protect the civilians...
Most of the guards that held the Gibdos
off are still recovering from their injuries.

Hopefully this <clr:0000>new unit <clr:ffff>can help us
avenge our comrades and return to the
surface. But first they must finish training.
talk21:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Well, the Gibdos did a serious number on
us before.

It was so bad that some of the guards
who fought in the <clr:0000>first encounter<clr:ffff> are
still recovering from their wounds.
I believe that partly has to do with how
hard it is to protect yourself while using a
spear. Both hands are full, you see.
So I've established a new unit that will
use a sword and <clr:0000>shield<clr:ffff> instead. They can
better guard themselves that way.
talk22:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>In that first encounter... Well, if <clr:0000>Lady Riju<clr:ffff>
hadn't been there with her <clr:0000>control of
lightning<clr:ffff>, we might have been wiped out.
All the more reason to get the new unit
ready. We have to keep <clr:0000>Lady Riju<clr:ffff> safe.
talk10:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>If you've got something to say, please
make it quick.

After our humbling <clr:0000>first encounter <clr:ffff>with
the Gibdos, I realized that we needed to
establish a <clr:0000>new unit<clr:ffff> to combat them.
The new unit is in the middle of training.
They need to get into fighting shape fast
since the enemy could strike at any time...
talk11:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>It's fine if you're going to fight alongside
us. Just try not to get in the way.

The best thing to do is make sure all our
defenses are ready for what's coming.
talk25:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>I'd wanted to attach <clr:0000>electricity-emitting
material <clr:ffff>to our weapons, kind of like Lady
Riju's ability...
But they're rare, valuable items that have
to be taken from <clr:0000>Electric Lizalfos<clr:ffff>.

<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Sad_00>So instead, we'll try using <clr:0000>materials that
generate fire<clr:ffff>. Maybe those will work?
Here's hoping...
talk12:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>Haha! It looks like the flames are pretty
effective! We'll burn up these monsters!
talk13:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Happy>That was a brilliant battle! <sp:5:0:0>Everyone did
their part to keep the town safe!

I'm especially proud of our new sword-
and-shield unit. The idea, and the hard
work of those guards, paid off...
talk14:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Sure, we've saved the town, driven off
the Gibdos, and the <clr:0000>sand shroud<clr:ffff> has
passed... But we cannot relax!
Or at least, we cannot completely relax...
